intro: Ohwia luteola, commonly known as the yellow starwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in a star-like pattern, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas or along the edges of wetlands. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a slight reddish tinge when young. Ohwia luteola is an annual herb that blooms from late spring to early summer, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitats.
